Description: Glazed composition shabti of Neskhnum son of Rudjper (?) with a lappet-wig, a modelled face with ears and a beard and parallel incised hands holding two hoes; the front of the body is inscribed with a column of incised Hieroglyphs, the back is decorated with an incised representation of a seed-basket; there is a plinth beneath the foot.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Lt-Gen Augustus W H Meyrick
